page_analysis.text_content:
Fig 4  Types of porches and entry ways

A  Roofed porch

B  Roofed entry way
(not vaulted)

C  Vaulted entry way

D  Combination porch & vaulted entry way

See how to measure height of porches & entry features in Figs 6-8 on pp. 11-13

Height less than 12" above grade
Height greater than 12" above grade
Height greater than 12" above grade

visual_elements.description: Four architectural line drawings illustrating different types of porches and entry ways labeled A through D. A shows a roofed porch with a low roof supported by columns. B shows a roofed entry way (not vaulted) attached to a house with a steep roof. C shows a vaulted entry way on a house facade with dormer windows and a prominent arched entry. D shows a combination porch and vaulted entry way with arches and a tower-like structure. Each drawing includes a vertical dimension line indicating height relative to grade, with notes specifying whether the height is less than or greater than 12 inches above grade.
visual_elements.location: Distributed across the page: A top left, C top right, B bottom left, D bottom right

visual_elements.description: A gray shaded box centered on the page with white text instructing to see how to measure height of porches and entry features in Figs 6-8 on pages 11-13.

technical_specifications.parameter: Height of porch or entry feature
Height of porch or entry feature

additional_notes: No handwritten annotations, stamps, or markings detected.
Page layout is clean with four labeled architectural drawings arranged in a grid pattern and a centered instructional text box.
Page number or footer shows a single '/' symbol at bottom right.
cross_references: See how to measure height of porches & entry features in Figs 6-8 on pp. 11-13
